ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Chains
ygData.msgSnippet: Ya, Stone Spider room. We were there the other night.  One of the rangers was scrambling frantically to try to mem snare for a LavaDuctCrawler.  Don t bother.
ygData.messageBody:
Ya,

Stone Spider room. We were there the other night. One of the rangers was
scrambling frantically to try to mem snare for a LavaDuctCrawler. Don't
bother. It only runs to the foot of the ramp to the lair and stops there.
Soon enough you begin to anticipate his "break" and try to run over and beat
him there. But this is the exception. I remember lots of other places
where "no runners" was the rule to live (or die) by.

Fighting a Greater Kobold that wandered thru...

"Should I just fear him and see what he can pull for us?"

Sylly

p.s. I did that in the bat room once in an emergency (feared off a couple
bats). Heh, they pulled an imp. Emergency soon became near disaster. We
zoned.

> From: "Jeff Illian" <jeff@...>
>

> I'm starting to see that a lot of our differences have more to do with
what
> and where we are fighting then how to use the song. I don't tend to need
> chains when fighting for XP because in the places I fight at for XP, we
> don't care about runners. Oggok bouncers, specs, giants, etc... you
simply
> don't need to stop these things as they really don't run far and if they
do,
> so what. I don't think you would disagree with my assessment of chains
on
> things like Efreeti raids or dungeon crawls though :).
